greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Minimal m >= 1 such that floor((2*n-1)!!/m) + 2 is prime.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..500
maple: for m while not isprime(iquo(doublefactorial(2*n-1), m)+2)
mathematica: a[n_] := Module[{m}, For[m = 1, True, m++, If[PrimeQ[Floor[(2n-1)!!/m]+2], Return[m]]]];
results.author: _Vladimir Shevelev_, Feb 14 2013
ext: More terms from _Alois P. Heinz_, Feb 18 2013
